original:
The taxonomy of lichens was first extensively studied by the Swedish botanist Erik Acharius (1757–1819), who is often referred to as the "father of lichenology." Acharius was a student of Carl Linnaeus and made significant contributions to the field, marking the establishment of lichenology as a distinct scientific discipline. His notable works include:

- - - - 
Subsequent lichenologists have expanded upon Acharius's foundational work.
sampled: The taxonomy of lichens was first diligently studied by the Swedish Field Rune Acharius (1757–1819), who is often proclaimed to as the "father in pathology." Acharius was a student of Carl Researcher and made significant contributions to the field, marking the establishment of lichenology as a distinct rigorous discipline. His notable works include: - - - - Subsequent lichenologists have augmented upon Acharius's foundational work.
